page.title: 01COUNTRYSIDE AROUND MILTON.
page.content: Most of our landscape in south Fife is farmland and{Milton's}338 people form the only community in the western half.The eastern half has Balcurvie / Windygates,Methilhill and parts of Kennoway,Methil and Buckhaven. Cameron Hospital ,Cameron Distillery and Buckhaven High School are landmarks there.{The River Leven, } flowing from Loch Leven,meanders from west to east across the middle of our block.It is an important feature of it.1 kilometre east of Milton it is joined by the River Ore from the south,and 2 kms further on,by the Kennoway Burn from the north.The rivers meet the Forth at Leven,7 kms away.Markinch Burn,flowing 2 kms north of the River Leven and parallel to it,joins Kennoway Burn.A good road follows the river valley.
